title: Jacob's Creek 2015 Classic Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)
description: Melon and citrus aromas and flavors mingle easily in this cleanly made quaffer. It's a bit plump on the palate, yet refreshing on the lemon-lime finish.

title: Punset 2011 Campo Quadro Riserva  (Barbaresco)
description: This opens with unusual aromas that recall minestrone soup, celery and glazed onion that carry over to the palate. It lacks fruit richness and is rather muddled, offering flavors reminiscent of sweet and sour sauce. Tasted both bottles, same notes.

title: Marchesi di Barolo 2009 Riserva  (Barolo)
description: Roasted coffee bean and menthol aromas lead the nose while the evolved palate offers dark bitter chocolate, licorice and a toasted note. Showing the heat of the vintage, the fruit has largely dried up while astringent tannins lead to a bracing finish.

title: McPherson 2014 Sangiovese (Texas)
description: There seems to be a dusty veil over the fruit of this sold, approachable Sangiovese. A bit of sweet spice creeps up on the palate, making it enjoyable by itself or paired alongside pizza Tuesday.

title: La Bioca 2013 Lurens  (Barbaresco)
description: Raw oak, coconut and roasted coffee bean aromas carry over to the palate along with licorice and espresso but it lacks fruit richness. Astringent, grainy tannins clench the bracing finish.

title: Lagarde 2013 Henry Legarde Malbec (Luján de Cuyo)
description: Roasted, stewed berry aromas are rustic and suggestive of grilled meat. This is high in acidity, and thus it feels sharp and edgy. Flavors of forced oak, related spice and tart plum end with a scraping, tannic feel and herbal berry flavors.

title: Patriarche Père et Fils 2014  Coteaux Bourguignons
description: This light and fruity wine offers soft tannins and an earthy character. The wine comes mainly from Beaujolais with 15% of Pinot Noir from the Mâcon region. Drink now.

title: Paul Reitz 2014  Saint-Véran
description: This wine has acidity and a good balance between the fresh, crisp character and the richer yellow fruits. It is ready to drink.

title: Pech Merle 2013 Treborce Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Ripe plum and plenty of vanilla and cherry provide the perception of sweetness in this wine. That sensation may stem from the pushing-the-envelope generosity of the ripe fruit or from the oak. or both. It makes for a full-bodied, heady experience.

title: Tercos 2015 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Baked, spicy berry and dark plum aromas are leathery and a touch hot. Rather dense and soupy, with slightly rough tannins, this tastes of baked berry fruits, while the finish tastes lightly salty and feels rubbery.

title: Ribafreixo 2015 Pato Frio Antão Vaz (Alentejo)
description: The grape is local to the Vidigueira region of the southern Alentejo. Coming from cool vineyards, the wine has a fresh character that is balanced by the ripe melon and juicy pear fruits. It has a crisper end and is ready to drink.

title: Yalumba 2014 The Y Series Sauvignon Blanc (South Australia)
description: Hints of pungent boxwood mark the nose of this lean, narrowly constructed wine. The flavors are grassier, “rounded out” by tart citrus and green tomato notes. Drink now.

title: THP 2013 Stampede Red (Texas High Plains)
description: There's a solid grip to this blend of 54% Aglianico, 21% Montepulciano, 14% Tempranillo and 11% Barbera. Bramble berries and earthy geraniums give this medium-bodied red some interest.

title: Tramier et Fils 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: Ripe yellow fruits shine through this attractive wine. It has a fresh, crisp side with lemon acidity that nicely balances the warm, rounded texture. It delivers a crisp, more mineral aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Bulletin Place 2015 Pinot Grigio (South Eastern Australia)
description: Nicely rendered, with varietally correct aromas of pear, citrus and almond skin. There's a bit of texture to this wine's medium-bodied palate before it eases into a clean, mouthwatering finish.

title: Burrell School Vineyards 2011 Spring Break Pichon Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Zesty peppercorns, underripe berries, Kalamata olive, green olive and crushed thyme show on the nose of this bottling. There's almost a touch of effervescence on the sip, where tart berries, lavender, green peppercorns and more Kalamata olive make for a fresh and fruity experience, which isn't much like Syrah.

title: Boffa 2013  Barbaresco
description: This opens with muddled aromas of floral air freshener, ripe black plum, wet fur and a funky whiff of game. The rustic palate falls apart quickly, showing dried cranberry, a hint of dried herb and fleeting tannins.

title: Brennan 2015 Reserve Newburg Vineyard Viognier (Texas)
description: Succinct and to-the-point, this Viognier is bight in pineapple, citron and peach on the nose and palate. There's a decent weight and texture, however the flavors don't carry too long. Drink now.

title: Cliff Creek 2011 Cabernet Franc (Southern Oregon)
description: Released late, this may have benefitted somewhat with the extra bottle age, but it's still showing substantial tannins. Tart, barely ripe berry fruit quickly rolls into a short, chalky finish.

title: DanCin 2013 Tribute Red (Southern Oregon)
description: Tribute is a blend of 43% Barbera, 43% Sangiovese and 14% Nebbiolo—a difficult enterprise at best, particularly with fruit from young vines. It's thin and generic, showing no distinct varietal character.

title: Domaine de l'Echelette 2015  Mâcon-Cruzille
description: This wine has a creamy, smooth character. Lightly buttery and with some ripe pear flavors, it is soft, refreshing and ready to drink.

title: Domaine des Valanges 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: This wine is tight with the lightest hints of riper fruit in the future. It has spice, toast flavors and suggestions of yellow fruit. Wait to drink this wine until 2017.

title: Casca Wines 2015 Winemaker Selection White (Lisboa)
description: This is an attractive, soft and ripe wine. It has just enough acidity to give this blend that has 40% Chardonnay a crisp aftertaste. The wine with its melon and pear flavors is ready to drink.

title: Chakana 2014 Estate Selection Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Light, lemony aromas work for the most part. This feels full, even creamy. Flavors of papaya, melon and apple finish with a note of pineapple. The longer this sits, the more soft and tropical it becomes.

title: Belles Vignes 2014 Grenache-Syrah-Marselan Red (Vin de France)
description: Scents of violet, brambly berry and blackcurrant leaf lead the bouquet of this earthy blend, with a light gamy character in the background. The palate is bright and lively, with attractive freshness and fine tannins that result in a clean, juicy finish.

title: Domaine Olivier Merlin 2014  Saint-Véran
description: This is a bright, spicy wine full of citrus flavors, with attractive toast and acidity. It's lively, with a tangy backbone that gives a really crisp aftertaste.

title: Evans & Tate 2015 Breathing Space Pinot Grigio (Australia)
description: This medium-bodied wine doesn't show much of the variety's mouthfeel, but does show clean, dry flavors of melon and citrus. Enjoy it now through the end of 2016.

title: Maurice Martin 2014  Pouilly-Fuissé
description: Ripe melon flavors show strongly in this soft, rounded wine from organic grapes. It has acidity and a tang of zesty orange that cuts through the smooth texture. Drink this refreshing, rich wine now.

title: Moscato Bella 2014 Sweet Red Black Muscat (California)
description: This wine has a deep rose color, an aroma like watermelon and flavors like canteloupe and watermelon sprinkled with sugar. It feels smooth and almost thick.

title: Jacques Capsouto 2014 Cotes de Galilee Village Cuvee Eva Blanc White (Galilee)
description: Made from Grenache Blanc, Roussanne, Clairette and Marsanne, this wine has a soft nose of white peach and lemon zest. It is slightly stiff on the palate, with flavors of white peach, fennel bulb, apricot and rye. The finish is marked by a slight touch of menthol followed by a burst of tangerine flavor.
designation: Cotes de Galilee Village Cuvee Eva Blanc
